subject: Education
title: Behaviorism: Learning as Conditioning
description: A 60-second lesson on Behaviorism: Learning as Conditioning.

hook.text: Skinner trained pigeons to play ping-pong. Then he applied the same principles to children.

buildup.text: Behaviorism says learning is observable behavior change caused by environmental stimuli and reinforcement.

discovery.text: Positive reinforcement strengthens behavior; punishment suppresses it (but doesn't eliminate it).

twist.text: Behaviorism can't explain creativity, insight, or language acquisitionâ€”it treats the mind as a black box.

climax.text: Classroom management systems, token economies, and drill-based learning all descend from behaviorism.

punchline.text: Behaviorism explained how we train. It forgot to explain how we think.

quiz.question: What is behaviorism's main limitation as an educational theory?
options: It can't explain creativity, insight, or internal mental processes
It only works with animals, never with humans
